shipModes._description: How to ship completed tasks. The autopilot chooses the mode per-task based on risk and efficiency.

branchPr.description: Full ceremony: branch, test, PR, merge. Safest, most expensive (~12 turns overhead).
branchPr.useWhen: FEATURE tasks, MEDIUM-risk changes, multi-file logic changes, any change you're not 100% confident about

directToMain.description: Commit directly to main after tests pass. Cheapest (~3 turns overhead).
directToMain.useWhen: LOW-risk MAINTENANCE tasks under 100 lines: test additions, config tweaks, dead code removal, documentation updates, adding guards or validation
directToMain.safeguards: Must pass npm test before AND after commit. If post-commit test fails, immediately revert with git revert HEAD.

batch.description: Group 2-4 compatible small tasks into one branch/PR. Medium cost (~15 turns for 3 tasks vs ~36 for 3 separate PRs).
batch.useWhen: Multiple MAINTENANCE tasks in the same pillar or touching the same files. Tasks must be independently correct (each commit passes tests).

turnBudgets._description: Expected turn costs per activity. Updated by the autopilot based on actual measurements.

processNotes._description: Accumulated process knowledge. The autopilot adds notes here about what works and what doesn't.
